result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott H. Woitczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott H. Woitczak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott H. Woitczak was found guilty of Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to his extended supervision.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or combination thereof.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Not possess any dangerous weapons.

Comply with all treatment recommendations for alcohol and drug treatment. 
Be in full compliance with drug and alcohol treatment.  
If assessment is necesarry at that time one can be requested by the agent. 
Required to have completed the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program. If he has proof that he completed that in prison or while on extended supervision and there have been no further domestic violence incidents, then he will not have to do that while on probation.  If he doesn't receive it in prison or while on extended supervision, then he will have to do that while on probation.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Court will allow early discharge off probation if he has been in complete compliance and at the agents discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott H. Woitczak in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Scott H. Woitczak in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:19 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Knaapen makes statements re: information and complaint.  Prior conviction is a felony so as a repeat offender he could face 7 years instead of 3 years of confinement. 
Atty Drengler concurs. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 2 -  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed outright. 
Counts 3 & 4 are dismissed and read-in. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 2 - 
6 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision - STAYED -
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, consecutive to his extended supervision. 
Comply with all treatment recommendations for alcohol and drug treatment. 
Be in full compliance with drug and alcohol treatment.  
If assessment is necesarry at that time one can be requested by the agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or combination thereof. 
Required to have completed the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program. If he has proof that he completed that in prison or while on extended supervision and there have been no further domestic violence incidents, the he will not have to do that while on probation.  If he doesn't receive it in prison or while on extended supervision, then he will have to do that while on probation.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Pay the DNA surcharge, Domestic Abuse surcharge, filing fee and victim witness surcharge. 
Court finds he has the abliity to pay. 
Court will allow early discharge off probation if he has been in complete compliance and at the agents discretion. 
0 pretrial credit.

Court advises 20 days to appeal. 
Court addresses credit, questions Atty Drengler.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  
No contact direct or indirect with Victoria Lahmen.

1/5/2015:  Court will amend the bond to allow contact with Kaysee Bushar but there is to be no abusive including emotional or physical, contact.  Not to reside together.

Defendant Scott H. Woitczak in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Scott H. Woitczak in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Atty Drengler makes arguments re: no contact order of the bond.  Asks that be amended to No abusive contact given the safety plan was filed. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments.  Indicates he has not seen the letter or the safety plan in their office.  Notes the victim is present. 

Court reviews the file.
Victim is present and questioned by the Court. 
Victim is asking to speak to him via phone and visit with him while he's in the jail. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will not allow the parties to reside together.  There is a family safety plan filed in the case.  The victim is here freely and voluntarily.  Court will amend the bond to allow contact but there is to be no abusive including emotional or physical, contact.  Not to reside together.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
requesting no contact be lifted by K.B.
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by K.B. - wants contact but court ordered no contact.

Defendant Scott H. Woitczak in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Scott H. Woitczak in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:16 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment to be held on a subsequent date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond Continued  Arraignment scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Scott H. Woitczak appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan W. Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.

Defendant makes statements to the Court.  
Atty Drengler makes statements.  Requests amendment to the no contact with Ms. Bushar. 
Court reviews the file. Court asks that defense file a motion with Br 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  
No contact direct or indirect with Kaysee Bushar and Victoria Lahmen.

DA #14PT2248
Anticipated: Battery
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Battery.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. (on probation hold)
State requests a $5.000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

BTC: $5.000 cash bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  No contact direct or indirect with Cassey Bushar and Victoria Lahmen.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   12-15-14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
